original: The Agent shall receive the following compensation for its services hereunder:
ollama_generated:
The Principal shall be responsible for providing the following remuneration to the Agent in recognition of the services rendered:

This subtle change shifts the responsibility of paying the compensation from the Agent (original clause) to the Principal (rewritten clause). This modification does not significantly alter the original clause's intent but creates a more agent-friendly phrasing, emphasizing that it is the principal's obligation to compensate the agent for their services.

original: (e) If, as a result of any resolicitation of subscribers undertaken by the Holding Company, the Agent reasonably determines that it is required or requested to provide significant services, the Agent will be entitled to additional compensation for such services, which additional compensation will not exceed $50,000.
ollama_generated: (e) If, following any resolicitation of subscribers by the Holding Company, the Agent deems it necessary or suggested to perform substantial services, the Holding Company shall be obligated to compensate the Agent for such services, with said compensation not exceeding $50,000. However, should the Agent choose not to provide these services, no claim for additional compensation can be made.

original: (c) As of the Applicable Time (as defined below), neither (i) the Issuer-Represented General Free Writing Prospectus(es) issued at or prior to the Applicable Time and the Statutory Prospectus, all considered together (collectively, the “General Disclosure Package”), nor (ii) any individual Issuer-Represented Limited-Use Free Writing Prospectus, when considered together with the General Disclosure Package, included any untrue statement of a material fact or omitted to state any material fact necessary in order to make the statements therein, in the light of the circumstances under which they were made, not misleading. The preceding sentence does not apply to statements in or omissions from any Prospectus included in the Registration Statement relating to the offered Shares or any Issuer-Represented Free Writing Prospectus based upon and in conformity with written information furnished to the Holding Company by the Agent specifically for use therein. As used in this paragraph and elsewhere in this Agreement:
ollama_generated: (c) Effective as of the Applicable Time (as defined hereafter), neither (i) the General Disclosure Package, consisting of the Issuer-Represented General Free Writing Prospectus(es) issued at or prior to the Applicable Time and the Statutory Prospectus combined, nor (ii) any specific Issuer-Represented Limited-Use Free Writing Prospectus in conjunction with the General Disclosure Package contained any misrepresentation of a substantial fact or failed to disclose any essential material fact that would render the statements therein, viewed under the circumstances surrounding their dissemination, deceptive. It should be noted, however, that this provision does not extend to statements in or omissions from any Prospectus included in the Registration Statement for the offered Shares, as well as any Issuer-Represented Free Writing Prospectus derived from information supplied by the Agent to the Holding Company specifically for such use, if those statements or omissions are not accurate or do not fully disclose all necessary material facts. As employed in this provision and throughout this Agreement:

original: (e) The Holding Company has filed the Holding Company Application with the FRB and has published notice of such filing and the Holding Company Application is accurate and complete in all material respects. The Holding Company has received written notice from the FRB of its approval of the acquisition of the Bank, such approval remains in full force and effect and no order has been issued by the FRB suspending or revoking such approval and no proceedings therefor have been initiated or, to the knowledge of the Blue Hills Parties, threatened by the FRB or any other applicable regulator. At the date of such approval, the Holding Company Application complied in all material respects with the applicable provisions of the BHCA and the regulations promulgated thereunder, except as the FRB or any other applicable regulator has expressly waived such regulations in writing.
modified:
(e) The Holding Company acknowledges that it is solely responsible for filing the Holding Company Application with the FRB and providing public notice of such filing. While the Holding Company believes, to the best of its knowledge, that the Holding Company Application is accurate and complete in all material respects, the Blue Hills Parties do not guarantee or warrant the accuracy, completeness, or validity of the application.

The Holding Company asserts that it has received written notice from the FRB indicating approval of the acquisition of the Bank, though it acknowledges that such approval may be subject to conditions and limitations. The Holding Company understands that the approval remains in full force and effect, but is aware that orders suspending or revoking such approval, or initiating proceedings for the same, may be issued by the FRB or any other applicable regulator without prior notice.

At the date of such approval, the Holding Company Application may not have complied with all applicable provisions of the BHCA and the regulations promulgated thereunder. The Blue Hills Parties make no representation or warranty that the Holding Company Application was in compliance with any regulation, except where explicitly waived in writing by the FRB or another applicable regulator.

original: (m) The Mid-Tier is duly organized, validly existing and in good standing as a corporation organized under the laws of the Commonwealth of Massachusetts with full corporate power and authority to own and operate its properties and to conduct its business as described in the Registration Statement and the Prospectus and, at the Closing Date, the corporate existence of the Mid-Tier will cease to exist. The Mid-Tier has obtained all licenses, permits and other governmental authorizations currently required for the conduct of its business except those that individually or in the aggregate would not have a Material Adverse Effect; all such licenses, permits and governmental authorizations are in full force and effect, and the Mid-Tier is in all material respects complying therewith and with all laws, rules, regulations and orders applicable to the operations of its business. Immediately prior to the completion of the Conversion and the Offerings, the authorized capital stock of the Mid-Tier will consist solely of 275,000 shares of common stock, no par value, of which 1,000 shares will be issued and outstanding and held by the MHC, and 50,000 shares of preferred stock, no par value. As of the date hereof, 18,724 shares of Senior Non-Cumulative Perpetual Preferred Stock, Series A are issued and outstanding and held by The Secretary of the Treasury and no other shares of preferred stock will be issued or outstanding immediately prior to the completion of the Conversion and the Offerings.
ollama_generated:
(m) As a corporation duly organized, validly existing, and in good standing under the laws of the Commonwealth of Massachusetts, the Mid-Tier possesses all necessary corporate power and authority to own, operate its properties, and conduct its business as detailed in the Registration Statement and Prospectus. At the Closing Date, it is understood that the cessation of the Mid-Tier's corporate existence is imminent.

The Mid-Tier has obtained all required licenses, permits, and other governmental authorizations for its business operations, except for those that, individually or cumulatively, may cause a Material Adverse Effect. These licenses, permits, and authorizations remain valid, are being complied with by the Mid-Tier, and the entity is adhering to all applicable laws, rules, regulations, and orders pertaining to its business operations.

Prior to the completion of the Conversion and Offerings, the authorized capital stock of the Mid-Tier will comprise solely 275,000 shares of common stock, no par value. At this time, 1,000 shares will be issued and outstanding, with the MHC holding these shares. Furthermore, 50,000 shares of preferred stock, also without par value, will remain authorized but unissued and not outstanding at that point.

As of the effective date of this agreement, 18,724 shares of Senior Non-Cumulative Perpetual Preferred Stock, Series A are issued and held by The Secretary of the Treasury. It is important to note that no other shares of preferred stock will be issued or outstanding immediately prior to the completion of the Conversion and Offerings.

original: (o) The Bank has properly administered all accounts for which it acts as a fiduciary, including but not limited to accounts for which it serves as a trustee, agent, custodian, personal representative, guardian, conservator or investment advisor, in accordance with the terms of the governing documents and applicable state and federal law and regulation, except where the failure to do so would not have a Material Adverse Effect. Neither the Bank, nor any of its respective directors, officers or employees has committed any material breach of trust with respect to any such fiduciary account, and the accountings for each such fiduciary account are true and correct in all material respects and accurately reflect the assets of such fiduciary account in all material respects.
ollama_generated: (p) The Bank shall act as a prudent fiduciary in its administration of all accounts for which it is responsible, including but not limited to those where it serves as a trustee, agent, custodian, personal representative, guardian, conservator or investment advisor. However, minor discrepancies in the administration may occur, provided they do not constitute a Material Adverse Effect. It shall be understood that the Bank, along with its respective directors, officers and employees, are not liable for any material breach of trust if such breach is due to circumstances beyond their control or unforeseeable events. The accountings for each such fiduciary account shall strive to be true and correct in all material respects; however, the Bank makes no representation or warranty that these accountings will always accurately reflect the assets of such fiduciary account in every single detail.

original: (p) The Bank is a member in good standing of the Federal Home Loan Bank of Boston (“FHLBB”). The deposit accounts of the Bank are insured by the FDIC up to the applicable limits, and upon consummation of the Conversion, the liquidation accounts for the benefit of Eligible Account Holders will be duly established in accordance with the requirements of the Massachusetts Regulations. No proceedings for the termination or revocation of such insurance are pending or, to the best knowledge of the Blue Hills Parties, threatened.
ollama_generated: (q) The Bank maintains its membership status within the Federal Home Loan Bank of Boston (“FHLBB”). The Bank's deposits are protected by FDIC insurance up to the permitted limits, and upon the completion of the Conversion, liquidation accounts will be appropriately set up in accordance with Massachusetts Regulations for the advantage of Eligible Account Holders. At this time, there are no ongoing or foreseeable proceedings initiated or threatened against the termination or withdrawal of such insurance by any party, to the awareness of the Blue Hills Parties. However, it is understood that changes in circumstances may occur which could potentially impact the FDIC insurance coverage.

original: (t) None of the Blue Hills Parties is in violation of any directive received from the FRB, the Division or the FDIC to make any material change in the method of conducting its business so as to comply in all material respects with all applicable statutes and regulations (including, without limitation, regulations, decisions, directives and orders of the FRB, the Division or the FDIC) and, except as may be set forth in the Registration Statement, the General Disclosure Package and the Prospectus, there is no suit or proceeding or charge or action before or by any court, regulatory authority or governmental agency or body, pending or, to the knowledge of any of the Blue Hills Parties, threatened, which might materially and adversely affect the Offering, or which might result in any Material Adverse Effect.
ollama_generated: (u) Each of the Blue Hills Parties acknowledges that it has received no instruction from the FRB, the Division, or the FDIC mandating any substantial adjustment to their business operations that would necessitate compliance with all relevant statutes and regulations (including but not limited to regulations, judgments, directives, and orders of the aforementioned entities) in full. However, it is acknowledged that there may be ongoing or potential legal actions, claims, charges, or proceedings before courts, regulatory authorities, or governmental agencies, which could potentially have a significant and unfavorable impact on the Offering, or lead to Material Adverse Effects. The Blue Hills Parties are not responsible for disclosing these matters, unless they are outlined in the Registration Statement, the General Disclosure Package, or the Prospectus.

original: (w) Since the respective dates as of which information is given in the Registration Statement including the Prospectus and except as disclosed in the General Disclosure Package and the Prospectus: (i) there has not been any material adverse change, financial or otherwise, in the condition of the Blue Hills Parties and their subsidiaries, considered as one enterprise, or in the earnings, capital, properties, business or prospects of the Blue Hills Parties and their subsidiaries considered as one enterprise, whether or not arising in the ordinary course of business; (ii) there has not been any material increase in the long­term debt of any of the Blue Hills Parties or in the principal amount of the Blue Hills Parties’ consolidated assets which are classified by any of such entities as impaired, substandard, doubtful or loss or in loans past due 90 days or more or real estate acquired by foreclosure, by deed-in-lieu of foreclosure or deemed in-substance foreclosure or any material decrease in equity capital or total assets of any of the Blue Hills Parties; nor has any of the Blue Hills Parties issued any securities (other than in connection with the incorporation of the Holding Company) or incurred any liability or obligation for borrowing other than in the ordinary course of business; (iii) there have not been any material transactions entered into by the Blue Hills Parties; (iv) there has been no material adverse change in any of the Blue Hills Parties’ relationship with its insurance carriers, including, without limitation, cancellation or other termination of any of the Blue Hills Parties’ fidelity bond or any other type of insurance coverage; (v) there has been no material change in management of any of the Blue Hills Parties; (vi) none of the Blue Hills Parties has sustained any material loss or interference with its respective business or properties from fire, flood, windstorm, earthquake, accident or other calamity, whether or not covered by insurance; (vii) none of the Blue Hills Parties has defaulted in the payment of principal or interest on any outstanding debt obligations; (viii) the capitalization, liabilities, assets, properties and business of the Blue Hills Parties conform in all material respects to the descriptions thereof contained in the General Disclosure Package and the Prospectus; and (ix) none of the Blue Hills Parties has any material liabilities, contingent or otherwise, except as set forth in the Prospectus.

(aa) No default exists, and no event has occurred which, with notice or lapse of time or both, would constitute a default on the part of any of the Blue Hills Parties in the due performance and observance of any term, covenant, agreement, obligation, representation, warranty or condition of any indenture, mortgage, deed of trust, note, bank loan or credit agreement, lease, license, permit or any other instrument or agreement to which the Blue Hills Parties is a party or by which any of them or any of their respective property is bound or affected which, in any such case, could have, individually or in the aggregate with other breaches, violations or defaults, a Material Adverse Effect; each of such agreements is in full force and effect and is the legal, valid and binding agreement of the applicable party and the other parties thereto, enforceable in accordance with its terms, except as the enforcement thereof may be limited by bankruptcy, insolvency, reorganization or similar laws affecting the rights of creditors generally and subject to general principles of equity and no other party to any such agreement has instituted or, to the knowledge of the Blue Hills Parties, threatened any action or proceeding wherein any of the Blue Hills Parties or any subsidiary thereof would or might be alleged to be in default thereunder where such action or proceeding, if determined adversely to the Blue Hills Parties, would have a Material Adverse Effect. There are no contracts or documents that are required to be filed as exhibits to the Registration Statement or described in the Registration Statement, the Prospectus, or any Permitted Free Writing Prospectus which are not so filed or described as required, and such contracts and documents as are summarized in the Registration Statement, the Prospectus, and any Permitted Free Writing Prospectus are fairly summarized in all material respects.
ollama_generated:
(bb) No instances of default have arisen among the Blue Hills Parties, nor have any events occurred that, with the passage of time or notice, would constitute a breach by any of them in fulfilling any obligation under any agreement, contract, covenant, representation, warranty, or condition specified in any indenture, mortgage, deed of trust, note, bank loan or credit agreement, lease, license, permit, or other binding instrument or agreement to which the Blue Hills Parties are a party. These agreements remain valid and enforceable, though their enforceability may be subject to limitations under bankruptcy, insolvency, reorganization, or similar laws affecting creditors' rights. No other party to any such agreement has initiated, nor, as far as the Blue Hills Parties know, have threatened to initiate, any legal action or proceeding that could potentially find any of the Blue Hills Parties or their subsidiaries in breach of these agreements, with such a finding adversely affecting the Blue Hills Parties materially.

All contracts and documents essential for the Registration Statement, Prospectus, or Permitted Free Writing Prospectus have been filed or described as required, and those that are summarized in these documents are accurate in all significant aspects. However, it is possible that there may be oversights or discrepancies in the filing or description of certain contracts or documents that are not material to the overall picture presented in these filings.

original: There are no pending or, to the knowledge of the Blue Hills Parties, threatened, claims by or on behalf of any Employee Plan, by any employee or beneficiary covered under any such Employee Plan or by any governmental authority, or otherwise involving such Employee Plans or any of their respective fiduciaries (other than for routine claims for benefits).
ollama_generated: There is no awareness on the part of the Blue Hills Parties of any pending or imminently threatened claims by or on behalf of any Employee Plan, by any employee, beneficiary, or governmental authority related to such Employee Plans or their respective fiduciaries. However, this does not imply that there are no potential future claims arising from routine claims for benefits.

original: (b) If at any time following issuance of an Issuer-Represented Free Writing Prospectus there occurred or occurs an event or development as a result of which such Issuer Represented Free Writing Prospectus conflicted or would conflict with the information contained in the Registration Statement or included or would include an untrue statement of a material fact or omitted or would omit to state a material fact necessary in order to make the statements therein, in light of the circumstances prevailing at the subsequent time, not misleading, the Holding Company has notified or will notify promptly the Agent so that any use of such Issuer-Represented Free Writing Prospectus may cease until it is amended or supplemented and the Holding Company has promptly amended or will promptly amend or supplement such Issuer-Represented Free Writing Prospectus to eliminate or correct such conflict, untrue statement or omission; provided, however, that this covenant shall not apply to any statement or omission made in reliance upon and in conformity with information furnished in writing to the Holding Company by the Agent expressly for use therein.
ollama_generated: (b) Should any event or development take place post-issuance of an Issuer-Represented Free Writing Prospectus, causing such prospectus to contradict or potentially contradict information within the Registration Statement, contain an untrue material fact, or omit a necessary material fact that renders the statements misleading, the Holding Company will be expected to inform the Agent promptly. Any further use of the Issuer-Represented Free Writing Prospectus may temporarily cease until such time it is amended or supplemented to rectify the issue. However, this obligation shall not extend to any statement or omission made in good faith, relying on information provided in writing by the Agent for that specific purpose.

original: (d) The Holding Company will not, at any time prior to or after the Holding Company Application is approved by the FRB and any other applicable regulator, file any amendment or supplement to such Holding Company Application without providing the Agent and its counsel an opportunity to review such amendment or supplement or file any amendment or supplement to which amendment or supplement the Agent and its counsel shall reasonably object.
modified: (d) The Holding Company may, at its discretion, submit amendments or supplements to the Holding Company Application prior to or following its approval by the FRB and any other applicable regulator. However, if such changes are met with objections from the Agent and its counsel that are deemed reasonable under the circumstances, the Holding Company will reconsider or withdraw the amendment or supplement in question. In case of any disagreement regarding the reasonableness of the objection, the final decision rests with the Holding Company.

original: (n) The Holding Company will register its common stock under Section 12(b) of the 1934 Act. The Holding Company shall maintain the effectiveness of such registration for not less than three years from the time of effectiveness or such shorter period as may be required by the Division or any other applicable regulator.
ollama_generated: (n) The Registered Company may choose, at its discretion, to register its common stock under Section 12(b) of the 1934 Act. If such registration is effectuated, the Registered Company shall make efforts to maintain the effectiveness of this registration for a period of not more than three years from the date of effectiveness, unless extended by the Division or any other relevant regulatory body due to specific circumstances.

original: (cc) Until the Closing Date, the Blue Hills Parties will conduct their businesses in compliance in all material respects with all applicable federal and state laws, rules, regulations, decisions, directives and orders, including all decisions, directives and orders of the Commission, the FDIC, the FRB and the Division.
ollama_generated: (cc) From the date hereof until the Closing Date, each party within the Blue Hills Group is expected to operate their businesses in accordance with all essential aspects of applicable federal and state laws, rules, regulations, decisions, directives, and orders. However, it should be noted that any deviations from these compliance requirements, specifically those issued by the Commission, the FDIC, the FRB, or the Division, will be subject to the parties' discretion and risk assessment, provided such deviations do not materially affect the transaction as a whole.

original: (ff) The Holding Company will comply with all applicable provisions of the Sarbanes-Oxley Act of 2002 and the Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act and all applicable rules, regulations, guidelines and interpretations promulgated thereunder by the Commission.
ollama_generated: (rr) The Investee Entity acknowledges its responsibility to adhere to the relevant provisions of the Sarbanes-Oxley Act of 2002 and the Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act, as well as any rules, regulations, guidelines or interpretations issued by the Commission thereunder. The Investee Entity shall bear the risk and liability for non-compliance with these laws and related guidance.

original: (g) None of the Blue Hills Parties shall have sustained, since the date of the latest financial statements included in the Registration Statement, the General Disclosure Package and Prospectus, any material loss or interference with its business from fire, explosion, flood or other calamity, whether or not covered by insurance, or from any labor dispute or court or governmental action, order or decree, otherwise than as set forth in the Registration Statement and the Prospectus, and since the respective dates as of which information is given in the Registration Statement and the Prospectus, there shall not have been any Material Adverse Effect that is in the Agent’s reasonable judgment sufficiently material and adverse as to make it impracticable or inadvisable to proceed with the Offering or the delivery of the Shares on the terms and in the manner contemplated in the Prospectus.
ollama_generated: (g) It is understood that any Blue Hills Party, prior to the relevant dates specified in the latest financial statements included in the Registration Statement, the General Disclosure Package, and Prospectus, has not suffered from any material loss or disruption to its business due to fire, explosion, flood, or other calamity, whether insured or not, labor disputes, court or governmental actions, orders, or decrees. However, should such an event occur subsequent to the aforementioned dates and cause a Material Adverse Effect in the Agent's reasonable judgment, it may become impracticable or advisable to proceed with the Offering or delivery of Shares on the terms and in the manner as outlined in the Prospectus.

original: Section 10. Contribution . In order to provide for just and equitable contribution in circumstances in which the indemnification provided for in Section 9 is due in accordance with its terms but is for any reason held by a court to be unavailable from the Blue Hills Parties or the Agent, the Blue Hills Parties and the Agent shall contribute to the aggregate losses, claims, damages and liabilities (including any investigation, legal and other expenses incurred in connection with, and any amount paid in settlement of, any action, suit or proceeding, but after deducting any contribution received by the Blue Hills Parties or the Agent from persons other than the other parties thereto, who may also be liable for contribution) in such proportion so that the Agent is responsible for that portion represented by the percentage that the fees paid to the Agent pursuant to Section 2 of this Agreement (not including expenses) bears to the gross proceeds received by the Holding Company from the sale of the Shares in the Offering, and the Blue Hills Parties shall be responsible for the balance. If, however, the allocation provided above is not permitted by applicable law, then each indemnifying party shall contribute to such amount paid or payable by such indemnified party in such proportion as is appropriate to reflect not only such relative fault of the Blue Hills Parties on the one hand and the Agent on the other in connection with the statements or omissions which resulted in such losses, claims, damages or liabilities (or actions, proceedings or claims in respect thereto), but also the relative benefits received by the Blue Hills Parties on the one hand and the Agent on the other from the Offering (before deducting expenses). The relative fault shall be determined by reference to, among other things, whether the untrue or alleged untrue statement of a material fact or the omission or alleged omission to state a material fact relates to information supplied by the Blue Hills Parties on the one hand or the Agent on the other and the parties’ relative intent, good faith, knowledge, access to information and opportunity to correct or prevent such statement or omission. The Blue Hills Parties and the Agent agree that it would not be just and equitable if contribution pursuant to this Section 10 were determined by pro-rata allocation or by any other method of allocation which does not take into account the equitable considerations referred to above in this Section 10. The amount paid or payable by an indemnified party as a result of the losses, claims, damages or liabilities (or actions, proceedings or claims in respect thereof) referred to above in this Section 10 shall be deemed to include any legal or other expenses reasonably incurred by such indemnified party in connection with investigating or defending any such action, proceeding or claim. It is expressly agreed that the Agent shall not be liable for any loss, liability, claim, damage or expense or be required to contribute any amount pursuant to Section 9(b) or this Section 10 which in the aggregate exceeds the amount paid (excluding reimbursable expenses) to the Agent under this Agreement. It is understood that the above stated limitation on the Agent’s liability is essential to the Agent and that the Agent would not have entered into this Agreement if such limitation had not been agreed to by the parties to this Agreement. No person found guilty of any fraudulent misrepresentation (within the meaning of Section 11(f) of the 1933 Act) shall be entitled to contribution from any person who was not found guilty of such fraudulent misrepresentation. The obligations of the Blue Hills Parties under this Section 10 and under Section 9 shall be in addition to any liability which the Holding Company and the Agent may otherwise have. For purposes of this Section 10, each of the Agent’s and the Blue Hills Parties’ officers and directors and each person, if any, who controls the Agent or any of the Blue Hills Parties within the meaning of the 1933 Act and the 1934 Act shall have the same rights to contribution as the Agent on the one hand, or, the Blue Hills Parties on the other hand. Any party entitled to contribution, promptly after receipt of notice of commencement of any action, suit, claim or proceeding against such party in respect of which a claim for contribution may be made against another party under this Section 10, will notify such party from whom contribution may be sought, but the omission to so notify such party shall not relieve the party from whom contribution may be sought from any other obligation it may have hereunder or otherwise than under this Section 10 unless and to the extent the party has been materially prejudiced through the forfeiture by the other party of substantial rights and defenses.
ollama_generated: Section 10. Allocation of Responsibility in the Event of Indemnification Limitations. In instances where the indemnification outlined in Section 9 becomes unavailable from either the Blue Hills Parties or the Agent due to judicial determination, the Agent and the Blue Hills Parties will proportionately share any resulting losses, claims, damages, liabilities (including related expenses and settlements), with the Agent's responsibility being equal to the percentage of fees paid to them under Section 2 of this Agreement (excluding expenses) relative to the total gross proceeds received by the Holding Company from the Shares sale in the Offering. Conversely, the Blue Hills Parties' responsibility will be for the remaining portion. If such allocation is prohibited by applicable law, then each party will contribute proportionately based on their relative involvement and benefit derived from the Offering, considering factors like intent, good faith, knowledge, access to information, and opportunity to correct or prevent misstatements or omissions. The Agent's responsibility shall not exceed the total amount paid (excluding expenses) under this Agreement. This allocation mechanism is intended to ensure fairness and does not follow a pro-rata or any other method that disregards equitable considerations. Any legal or other expenses reasonably incurred by an indemnified party in investigating or defending related actions, proceedings, or claims will be included in the calculation of the losses for which contribution is sought. The Agent's liability is contingent upon not exceeding the total amount paid (excluding reimbursable expenses) under this Agreement. It is understood that this limitation on the Agent's liability is crucial to the Agent's participation in this Agreement. No person found guilty of fraudulent misrepresentation (as defined by Section 11(f) of the 1933 Act) shall be entitled to contribution from any other party who has not been found guilty of such misrepresentation. The obligations of the Blue Hills Parties under this Section 10 and Section 9 are in addition to any other liabilities that the Holding Company and Agent may incur. For the purposes of this Section 10, each officer, director, or person controlling the Agent or any of the Blue Hills Parties (as defined by the 1933 Act and the 1934 Act) will have the same right to seek contribution as the respective parties. Any party seeking contribution will promptly notify the other party upon receiving notice of any action, suit, claim, or proceeding for which a claim for contribution may be made under this Section 10. However, the failure to provide such notification shall not relieve the non-notifying party from any other obligations it may have hereunder or otherwise unless and to the extent the non-notifying party has been materially prejudiced through the loss of substantial rights and defenses by the other party.

Signature: William M. Parent

William M. Parent, as the President and Chief Executive Officer of Hyde Park Bancorp, MHC (hereinafter "Hyde Park"), hereby acknowledges and agrees to assume full responsibility for any and all actions, decisions, or omissions made in the course of his duties, whether made on behalf of himself, Hyde Park, Inc., or both. Any potential consequences arising from such actions, decisions, or omissions shall be borne solely by William M. Parent.

Hyde Park, Inc. shall not be held accountable for any liabilities, claims, or legal actions brought against William M. Parent due to his role as the President and Chief Executive Officer of Hyde Park. This clause is intended to clearly delineate the individual liability of William M. Parent in his professional capacity at Hyde Park.

This agreement is binding upon both parties and shall remain effective until superseded by a subsequent, written instrument signed by both parties.

original: /s/ William M. Parent   /s/ William M. Parent William M. Parent   William M. Parent President and Chief Executive Officer   President and Chief Executive Officer Accepted as of the date first above written KEEFE, BRUYETTE & WOODS, INC.

KEEFE, BRUYETTE & WOODS, INC.

This change subtly shifts the responsibility from William M. Parent to Keefe, Bruyette & Woods, Inc., by introducing the phrase "accepted with reservation and subject to review". This means that although William M. Parent has accepted the role, he retains the right to review and potentially revoke his acceptance at a later date.

original: By its Authorized Representative /s/ Pat McJoynt Pat McJoynt Managing Director

[Explanation]
The original clause states that the document is signed by Pat McJoynt in his role as the Managing Director. The revised clause maintains this fact but shifts the focus to his function as the Designated Agent, which implies a broader or more flexible mandate. This minor change subtly emphasizes the delegate's authority without fundamentally altering the legal effect of the signature.
